column4: hi anybody... is there any way i can stretch my display beyond what xubuntu have to offer?
edit your xorg.conf
how would i do that? in termainl?  what is the path?
in a terminal: sudo nano /etc/X11/xorg.conf
just add the resolution you want, using the old ones as a guide
got it... so i just change the mode numbers... from "1280 x 800" to something else.. but im not sure about depth?
you there?  i got it.. but what do i do with "depth" part?
just leave it
hows it going?
done writing out.  do i need to restart?
you just need to restart x
ctrl+alt+backspace
lol.. it work... thanks, and bythe way, its my first time using linux so im learning.. slowly...  :)
np yw gl hf :)
would you be able to help me out more?  resizing the bar on top and bottom to smaller... its still big
im using xfce and dont know much about gnome, but couldnt you just right click them and select properties, or something?
yes it is. just right click any one if them
can you walk me thru it?  i dont see anything about resizing the bar... and hmm, what was the command again? sudo nano /etc/X11..?
nevermind, i found it... you just have to right-click on the bar itself
shoult be in your home
your home should be the first thing you are in when launching nautilus or a terminal
